block.p: Emma Elizabeth Mead, the daughter of Nancy Mead and the Rev. Andrew C. Mead of New York, was married yesterday to Antonio Melo, a son of Gloria Melo and Dr. Julio C. Melo of Louisville, Ky. The bride's father, who is the rector of St. Thomas Episcopal Church on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan, performed the ceremony there. The Rev. Kevin D. Robb, a Roman Catholic priest, took part in the service.
The bride and the bridegroom, both 27, graduated from Kenyon College, where they met.

Emma Elizabeth Mead, the daughter of Nancy Mead and the Rev. Andrew C. Mead of New York, was married yesterday to Antonio Melo, a son of Gloria Melo and Dr. Julio C. Melo of Louisville, Ky. The bride's father, who is the rector of St. Thomas Episcopal Church on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan, performed the ceremony there. The Rev. Kevin D. Robb, a Roman Catholic priest, took part in the service.
The bride and the bridegroom, both 27, graduated from Kenyon College, where they met.
Mrs. Melo was the drama teacher in the after-school program at Angier Elementary School in Newton, Mass., until June.

Mr. Melo is the director of content at Gigmania.com, a Web site based in Brooklyn that offers rock concert listings. His father is an infectious disease specialist in Louisville, and the bridegroom's mother manages her husband's practice.
